Detailed Description

The core console input/output class.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum CoreConsole::ColourTypes

Flags used for describing console colour output.

Enumerator:
FG_BLUE  Blue Foreground
FG_GREEN  Green Foreground
FG_RED  Red Foreground
FG_INTENSITY  Foreground intensity (makes the foreground colour a shade brighter)
BG_BLUE  Blue Background
BG_GREEN  Green Background
BG_RED  Red Background
BG_INTENSITY  Background intensity (makes the foreground colour a shade brighter)
FG_BROWN  Brown Foreground (Linux / Mac OS X)
FG_MAGENTA  Magenta Foreground (Linux / Mac OS X)
FG_CYAN  Cyan Foreground (Linux / Mac OS X)
BG_BROWN  Brown Background (Linux / Mac OS X)
BG_MAGENTA  Magenta Background (Linux / Mac OS X)
BG_CYAN  Cyan Background (Linux / Mac OS X)
FG_GRAY  Gray Foreground
FG_WHITE  White Foreground
BG_GRAY  Gray Background
BG_WHITE  White Background

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CoreConsole::CoreConsole (  ) 

The default constructor.

Allocates a new console (in Windows) for stdout and stderr output.

CoreConsole::CoreConsole ( FILE *  _outputBuffer  ) 

The alternate constructor.

Does not allocate a new console, and instead uses the specified FILE * for output.

Parameters:
_outputBuffer The destination buffer for CoreConsole output.
See also:
CoreConsole()

CoreConsole::~CoreConsole (  ) 

The destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void CoreConsole::Clear (  ) 

Clears the console.

Clears the console output (similar to commands 'cls' on Windows and 'clear' on Linux).

Determines whether the end of the file has been reached.

Returns:
Boolean indicating whether the end of the file has been reached.

int CoreConsole::Forward ( int  _position  )  [private, virtual]

Moves forward to a location in the buffer.

Parameters:
_position Position to seek to, relative to the current position in the buffer.
Returns:
An integer indicating the result of the operation. 0 indicates success. Any non-zero number indicates failure.

Reimplemented from CoreIO.

int  _bufferLength,
int  _bufferIndex,
int  _count 
) [private, virtual]

Reads a block of data from the file buffer.

Parameters:
_buffer The output buffer to read to.
_bufferLength The size of _buffer (in bytes).
_bufferIndex The position in _buffer to begin writing.
_count The number of bytes to read.

char CoreConsole::Read (  )  [virtual]

Does nothing.

To get input from the console, use std::cin.

Reimplemented from CoreIO.

Does nothing.

To get input from the console, use std::cin.

int CoreConsole::Seek ( int  _position  )  [private, virtual]

Seeks to a location in the buffer.

Parameters:
_position Position to seek to, relative to the first byte of the buffer.
Returns:
An integer indicating the result of the operation. 0 indicates success. Any non-zero number indicates failure.

Reimplemented from CoreIO.

void CoreConsole::SetColour ( short  _flags  ) 

Sets the console output colour.

Sets the console output colour using the flags specified in _flags.

Parameters:
_flags A bitmask created by OR-ing CoreConsole::ColourTypes flags.
